review.reviewBody: These are the lightest and breathable PFD’s I’ve ever owned…and clients love them as well!
review.name: Incredibly Light & Breathable

review.reviewBody: As recreational paddlers, this vest is perfect.  We both now have the same model.  The pockets are great for carrying / securing a whistle and car keys, an attached knife and probably more if one wants.  My favorite feature is the flotation in the back is above where my seat hits so it’s very comfortable.  The arm holes leave plenty of room for arm movement and since I’m a bit short waisted, the length in front is perfect as well.  Sturdy fabric that looks like it will last forever.  Great product!
review.name: Excellent design!

review.reviewBody: I'm looking for a PFD for kayaking. My seat back is high so I was looking forward to this Astral. I am 5' 2" and 34c. Unfortunately it is not available in XS so it ran large on me. Also the sides were very wide...my arms would have rubbed with each stroke. Perhaps a smaller version would have eliminated the chafing?
review.name: Darn...too big

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and lightweight I basically forgot I was wearing it. The zipper can be a bit tricky to line up but it seems durable and doesn't get too hot in the sun (as most zippers do).
review.name: Safety without the bulk

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this life jacket.  It is easily adjustabe and super comfortable to wear for all day paddles.  It also helps me stay cool on really hot days, and with it's adjustability, I can layer up for paddling on those cooler days. On top of all that, the color is so pretty.
review.name: EV-Eight is awesome!

review.reviewBody: This pfd is comfortable and easy to put on. The pockets are satisfactory, if a bit snug for a phone.
review.name: Easy-on

review.reviewBody: I really like the quality and fit of the EV-Eight. I wear it paddle boarding.
review.name: 5 stars!

review.reviewBody: An awesome lightweight PFD that fits and feels great on the water. Astral continues to provide great customer service in every regard.
review.name: Astral EV-Eight

review.reviewBody: Thin back, great venting, highly adjustable for a great fit.  Top notch.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Building on the franchise that is Astral's top selling PFD model, the EV-Eight takes all of the features of the original V-Eight model, and wraps it in a Bluesign approved recycled polyester face fabric - helping to achieve Astral's mission of protecting as much soil and water as possible.  

The EV-Eight features a breathable mesh back  and airescape foam in the front for the most breathable option in the Astral PFD lineup.  Lightweight and extremely packable, this model is also great for pairing with packrafts for flat or slow water adventures.
review.name: Best Named PFD ever?

name: EV-Eight Personal Flotation Device

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, nice color, & insulated - what's not to like?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I tried the boot on my lightweight bottle to keep the bottom from getting dinged up, but it makes the bottle a bit unsteady. Anyway, the dents add character.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It has a nice design and fit perfectly with 24 oz wide mouth trail series but I don't think it will give the same protection as the regular boot which is approximately 1 inch higher coverage. The only problem I have is that, I can't put it with perfect alignment. One side is approximately 3 - 4 mm higher than the other side or kinda wavy look. Not that bad but definitely not straight.
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a boot for all my hydro flasks except my coffee one. I love the boots as they help protect the bottle.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality and logo we sent in printed out clearly!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the smaller size and lighter weight of the trail series hydroflask bottle and the color is great. The fact that it came with the short protective boot was appreciated as well. Unfortunately, it does not keep the contents cold very long at all so I would hesitate to use it on the trail. It's too bad that the double wall construction of the bigger/original hydroflasks had to be sacrificed for the smaller more convenient size.
review.name: Good for shorter hikes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great bottle - it’s nice and light but so thin the bottle dents very easily.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Boot is perfect for me especially when riding my bike, because it stops the scratches that may occur from holder!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been rocking my older Breeze boots for over 4 years, so I couldn’t resist trying the new Breeze in size 9W. So far, they’re just as fantastic! Of course, I haven’t logged as many miles in them yet, but they’re just as lightweight and breathable as my trusty pair.

I love the modern look of these boots in the Trooper color, and I can’t stress enough how much I appreciate a wide fit for hiking. Vasque is my go-to for a reason—they last and keep my feet happy! I’m really pleased with this style.
review.name: A Fresh Take on a Trusted Favorite!
comment: Thanks for this great review! It's exciting that  your new boots are doing the trick for you! We can't wait to continue serving you.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable after a 10 mile break-in. True to size. Thank you for making wide sizes. Even though they are water-proof these boots do not run hot. Great ankle stability. Will purchase again.
review.name: Very comfortable, does not run hot!
comment: This is such a great review! I am so glad they are working well for you no matter the terrain.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the new breeze 6 months ago and had to change the shoe laces. My old breeze has a 60 inch lace. The new breeze ls 56 inches. The lace is too short. Go back to a 60 inch lace!!
The toe box is also lower than the breeze III-the top of my toes hit the top of the toe box, especially going down hill. And the sole has much less support than the breeze III. Cutting corners is very apparent in the new Breeze and is not appreciated.
review.name: Short shoe laces
comment: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.reviewBody:
I had to get a pair of boots for my new job. I work at a greenhouse and am on my feet for 9 hours a day, pulling very heavy (900#) carts up to 15 miles a day. I was excited when I found the Vasquez woman's breeze. Loved the color, and they were the perfect width of I went up a size. Although the VERY flat soles made my feet hurt, I was mostly satisfied my first day wearing them. Unfortunately they aren't waterproof whatsoever. Every day I get home, take my boots off and find my socks wet. No, it's not sweat.... It's where the mesh parts are on the top of the shoe. Pan to today. I worked 2 days ago. Here I am getting ready for work, go to put my boots on, and they are STILL WET INSIDE! THATS 48 HOURS! It's summer, it's not humid, they should be bone dry even if they were wet. 
I'm super disappointed in these boots. The only thing I'm actually happy with is how light weight they are. Unfortunately, I'm stuck with them because I can't afford a new pair of boots.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear your boots are not performing as expected. We will reach out to you directly to do what we can to assist via email.

review.reviewBody: Wore these on a 1.5 week long west coast road trip. No break in period at all. I wore them through Yosemite, 14 mile-hike through the Red Woods, and days in Washington (Mt. Rainer and Olympic National). I had to give my husband piggy-back rides through puddles and mud to keep his feet dry. I walked through ankle deep water and walked away completely dry. Not to mention I have wide feet and my feet felt fresh at the end of each day.
review.name: Hiked It. LOVED IT.
comment: Thank you for this amazing review! It sounds like these boots had quite the adventure with you and we hope they continue on many more!

review.reviewBody: I wire these for the first time today. They give great support and are very comfortable. The reason for the two star rating is because they did not keep my socks dry. . I walked through damp grass, and when I got home my socks were wet.
review.name: Good support not waterproof
comment: We are glad that you are comfortable, but we also want you to have dry feet. We will contact you via email to assist you.

review.reviewBody: THIS IS NOT THE SAME BOOT. I was so excited to see the return of the Breeze that I immediately purchased. My first pair of hiking boots was the Breeze II in a 7.5, and when I got a little older I purchased the Breeze III in an 8W. I loved that it had a rigid sole, plenty of space for my square-shaped toe area, and that it had unparalleled ankle support that kept my heel in place and prevented my toes from harm. My foot has gotten a little bigger and I went to purchase this new Breeze model in a 8.5W and am so disappointed. Everything I loved about the Breeze III is gone! Gone is the dual-density midsole which gives the feeling over a thicker sole with a higher torsional rigidity - the new Breeze model has a MUCH higher forefoot flex which I think is fine for a trail runner but cannot stand in a hiking boot. The new Breeze model has a much larger reinforced toe cap that extends to the metatarsals and decreases the total area of that breathable fabric at the top of the toe and at the sides of the boot - this higher profile means that there is much less flexibility at the top of the toe area, a problem for people with a more square foot or upturned toes that enjoyed not hitting a reinforced toe box every step. And the part that upsets me most: The ankle support is just gone. My favorite part of the Breeze III is that I can hike downhill all day and the rigid ankle support locks my heel in place and saves my toes the abuse. I think this is an all around fit change, but they did also change the midfoot locking hooks from a double shank to a single. You see all of these reviews from people who have had their Breezes "for years" and say it is such a great boot - THIS IS NOT THE SAME BOOT. Vasque, I beg of you, bring back the Breeze III!
review.name: Doesn't stand up to the Breeze III
comment: Thank you for your feedback, I will send this over to product creation to see if any revisions can be made i the future! We hope you choose to shop with us again.

review.reviewBody: I love my Vasque Breeze light gtx mids, the older version. They are just a bit narrow though, so I wanted to try this new version in wide for a multi day hike, since my feet will most likely swell and need the extra toe space. Trying them on in my house the sole felt lumpy and uncomfortable. I honestly thought it was a manufacturing error, it was that bad. Sad to return these and even have to pay the return shipping even though it seems like I got a messed up shoe.
review.name: I had high hopes

review.reviewBody: I was trying to replace my previous pair and couldn't find the right sizing, but these are great. They fit well for me for my widish front of foot and narrow heal. Lightweight, and what I really appreciate: not hideously colored! A solid waterproof boot. In running shoes I wear a 6.5 wide (asics), but 7 regular of these fit well.
review.name: Great looking and comfortable boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We hope to continue serving you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I have done 2- 5 mi hikes in these. Ankle support is great, which is what I got them for. But there is a lack of cushion in the foot bed particularly at the ball of the foot. Early on in the hikes the ball of my foot became painful increasing to decreased sensation in my toes by the end of the hike. I have experienced similar pain when wearing heels but never hiking shoes. Unfortunately, had to return.
review.name: Good ankle support, uncomfortable sole

name: Breeze Wide Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good hoodie, very comfy and warm. I loved the style and the material
review.name: Good hoodie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great looking sweatshirt. Seems to run a little snug but I always order sweatshirts a size up so still works well.
review.name: Great hoody

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] comfy crazy colored hoodie.   slightly small but ordered up. got on ultra sale, so quite happy with the purchase
review.name: comfy hoodie

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I now have two of these and have gone back to get more several times.  the only accurate comparison I can make is with that favorite pair of jeans that got perfect quick and will be worn till the bottom falls out, figuratively speaking of course.  Like those jeans, there is no flash or pomp, which wears out easily and will look dated well before the stitching fails. The Coastal's perfection is that of the bonsai, complete with balance and proportion. In fit and comfort it knows no equal (and i have a lot of hoodies). Aesthetically, i would have to call it versatile or even sublime. My other sweatshirts might call it a ball-hog.   Whether hiking the rhododendron filled gullies of New River Gorge near my house or at work as an arborist (where everything else seems to get torn) the blue and grey both seem to complete every outfit so i can focus on performance.  Seriously, my only complaint is that i havent been able to get all of the other perfectly matched color combos.
review.name: A hoody so perfect my favorite jeans are jealous

review.reviewBody: Super soft, warm, comfortable fit, functional hood. Love it.
review.name: Best Hoody I've Owned

review.reviewBody: Bought a Large, but it feels more like an athletic fit than a regular fit, so I had to return it.
review.name: Runs small

description: Buy the Nite Ize GlowStreak LED Ball online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GlowStreak LED Ball
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize GlowStreak LED Ball online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought one of these Nite Ize LED balls a long, long time ago. Like, when they first made their debut on display at the store I had to have one. I could tell right away that these balls were in a category unto themselves. I was right too. I wouldn't be surprised if someone told me that my Nite Ize LED glow ball has been with me for twenty years. I honestly do not remember when I got it, but it has been in my life a very long time. It has survived five dogs over the years. Sadly, earlier this month it died beyond my ability to resuscitate it anymore. 

Initially, I couldn't find the Nite Ize GlowStreak at any of my local stores, nor find it on Amazon. I thought they had been discontinued and I was very sad about it. Reluctantly I tried the Nerf LED balls. I went through three in less than three weeks. They are disgraceful and do not even begin to match the quality of the Nite Ize GlowStreak. 

It never crossed my mind to come directly to the Nite Ize website until a friend suggested it. I am so very happy to find that Nite Ize is still making and selling the GlowStreak LED balls, as well as discovering there is a new model to try as well. (Please never end these product lines!) 

Thank you Team Nite Ize! You have done a most excellent job. The quality, value, and durability of the GlowStreak LED balls, and all your other products I have bought, is truly appreciated. You have made me a very satisfied customer who will be with you for life. I have A LOT of your products and they all are appreciated just as much.
review.name: Simply, the best LED ball you'll ever buy.

review.reviewBody:
I have tried every light-up ball. Seriously. Most only stay lit for about 30 seconds after the ball is still. This doesn't help me find my forgetful dog's ball in the tall grass at the dog park in the dark. This stays lit. For a long time. Long enough to ask your dog 10 times where the ball is, then tromp through the grass to find it. And you will find it, because it is bright. Not blinding, but really lit up. The battery inside is secure. Really secure. And you can replace the battery. Most light up balls are "once the battery goes out you throw the ball away". And this ball bounces. There are some rechargeable balls out there. But it's like throwing a rock because those rechargeable balls are so heavy they don't bounce. My dog wants the ball to bounce. And they float. And it's a good size, my small dog likes it and so do bigger dogs, it's "medium" sized. 
So 1) It stays lit and the light is bright 2) It actually bounces 3) It floats 4) You can replace the battery 4) The battery inside is secure. 5) It's small enough for small dogs and big enough for big dogs. This is the ONLY light up ball that does those 5 things. And it comes in "disco" - it cycles through all the colors which is awesome. Literally every dog in the park wants this ball. My dog carries it around so proudly it is hilarious. This ball is the best out there.
review.name: Really the best light up ball

review.reviewBody:
I raise shibas and all of my boys have broken the mold and LOVED to fetch...but we have grueling summers here. The Glow Streak seemed like the perfect solution! 

My dogs absolutely loved it and we all loved being able to play and find the ball without suffering in the heat and humidity. 

However, I noticed that the ball didn't "turn off" as it should...still blinking on the kitchen counter a good half hour after I'd pried it away from the pups. In all their play i can understand wear and tear, but I don't think they should have been able to make this fatal bite. (Shibas are medium bite dogs). Either way...one weekend outside in a rainstorm and it no longer worked, and was completely rusted inside.
review.name: Wish it really was waterproof.

review.reviewBody: The best dog ball for night time fetch.  They're bright and the perfect size for the chuck it.  Unfortunately, they do go out within 2-4 weeks.  I haven't had great luck with replacing the batteries.  I think the wiring gets pulled apart after so many throws.  We have 2 high energy dogs that require a night walk every night.  These are the best night ball on the market.  We've tried them all.
review.name: Best night ball!

review.reviewBody: Our Malanois loves this ball. However, it does not stay lit even after multiple changes of batteries. I believe the electronics inside are faulty. The ball itself is excellent, and very durable. Would be great if the light up feature worked longer than a few evenings of throws.
review.name: Great ball, when it works

review.reviewBody: The idea of this ball is awesome! It lights up, it stays lit… exactly what I wanted… however my girls want a softer ball, a ball that squishes … so because this one isn’t squishy, I have a hard time getting them to play with it … but it does exactly what it says it does
review.name: Great Ball! Weird dogs

review.reviewBody:
I have bought four from Home depot and all four have failed. They are thrown on a turf football field. They do not work well in rain or the dog
slobber  is killing them. they are not water poof as advertised and when I go to replace the batteries there id rust in the components. the first two I had I thought I didn't have the cap on tight enough. I dont know how to tighten the cap better to prevent dog slobber or wet field  to keep them from leaking. I like them if they would work . $18.00 is a lot. Not sure I would recommend.
review.name: Not very happy with this product.
comment: Hi there, I am sorry to hear about the trouble you have been having with each of the Glowstreak balls you have. We would be happy to help get you some replacements for the faulty ones, as well as give you some helpful tips to keep them lasting longer. Please reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we will get you taken care of with our Worry-Free Guarantee.

review.reviewBody: Box says battery included: however,  not only did it not come with batteries it didn't even come with the part that holds the battery
review.name: Missing compartment
comment: Hi there, we are very sorry to see that you got one of our new GlowStreak Wild with no batteries or module inside of it. Luckily this can be an easy fix, reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we can get you a replacement through our Worry-Free Guarantee.

review.reviewBody: GOT 2 FOR MY TWO DOG AND NONE WORKED  NOT A GREAT CHRISTMAS PRESENT
review.name: JUKE RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX
comment: Hi there, I’m very sorry to hear that the balls you got didn’t work. We especially hate to hear that a Christmas present wasn’t working, if you could reach out to us at info@niteize.com, we would be happy to help you out. We can troubleshoot to see if we can get them working and if that doesn’t work, we can go through the Worry-Free Guarantee with you.

review.reviewBody: My FAVOURITE BALL (actually I mean “our” favourite) to use at the dog park or at night in the yard. The ball glows beautifully! Not to bright and not to dull. I find this draws & keeps my dogs attention even more so then a standard bounce ball. She is literally a nutcase when she realizes I have it on hand. The batteries are easy to replace, and last a really long time. Most Importantly, this ball is suitable for a dog that suffers with seizure activity, the colour changing features is a “Fade” between colours not rapid blinking sequences. The only time the ball gives off the “blinking” frequency is to let you know it’s going to shut off if it senses no activity
review.name: Glo-tastic

name: GlowStreak LED Ball

description: Buy the Edelrid Caddy II Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Caddy II Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Edelrid Caddy II Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had this bag for about 3 weeks. Fifth or sixth trip to the gym, the bag tore at the seam for the pull cord that tightens the bag. I thought the build quality was really nice until that happened... Would have been a great gym bag if the stitching held. But because of that issue, I would not recommend.
review.name: If the stitching was done right, great

review.reviewBody: I like so many things about this rope bag, however, my favorite is its shape. As a sphere, it seems to always fit perfectly in the bottom of my haul / crag bag. Other cylinder style bags never seemed to fit right with the rest of my gear.
review.name: Great Rope Bag!

review.reviewBody:
Edelrid is finding a way to innovate in some small, but incredibly useful ways lately. This Rope Caddy II is just about the perfect gym/easy approach crag rope bag.  

Its method of closure is simple, yet different and faster than anyone else. Ensure the rope is on the tarp - pick up the tarp at all four corners, give it a good shake and close everything up. Super fast, simple, and intuitive.

Keep in mind that this isn't the best bag for ALL situations, though. If I need to carry my rope for much of a distance on the approach, or if I want to carry a bunch of other gear in the bag (for something like a quick sport climbing session), I prefer the DMM rope bag with it's larger size and far superior compression and shoulder straps.

But, when I want a convenient, well built, and super fast/easy to use gym/crag rope bag I reach for this. Edelrid onsighted this one.
review.name: Maybe the Perfect Gym/Crag Rope Bag

name: Caddy II Bag

description: Buy the Louis Garneau Solano Chamois Tight - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solano Chamois Tight - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Solano Chamois Tight - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: True to size but looks small when you first take out of the package.  My husband is 6 feet tall and weighs 170-175 so the large fit him perfectly.  We live in the south so these cycling tights were warm enough during winter months.   Only thing that would make these better is  zippers at bottom of legs to help get them on and off.  I wash these in machine on "hand wash" cycle and air dry.  They wash up nicely and still look brand new after wearing them this winter.  Husband rides about 3-4 times a week approximately 20-25 miles a ride.
review.name: Review of tights

review.reviewBody:
I've picked up a new pair for the past few years to keep my gear fresh. Love these! I got my size dialled in perfect with Garneau gear which is a huge reason for returning even for my shorts. Fit is sweet, love the drawstring waist (all cycling lycra should have this), and the chamois fits in just the right place in the saddle. Newer versions seem thicker than my old (favorite) pair from past seasons.  I've worn them into the 20's and stayed toasty even though I'm not very aero with a puffy keeping my core warm??. If need be, I toss a pair of soccer shorts or windpants over them for extra protection, or to run to the store.  The chamois eliminates need for messing around layering over my summer shorts which feels wicked bulky to me. They are comfortable enough that I would probably wear them to lounge around the house if I didn't think it a little wierd.
These will continue to be my winter cycling tights until I find a warmer pair that doesn't destroy my meager budget!
review.name: Freakin awesome

name: Solano Chamois Tight - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Switchblade Ride GX Transmission Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: Purchased this bike after having rented a Swithcblade SLX build in Bend last summer. Love the bike overall but the SRAM brakes are by far the weakest link. While they have great stopping power, the modulation is not as refined as Shimano and they squeak like the proverbial greased pig. Still trying to get the suspension dialed into my liking. Seems a bit stiffer than I remember from the rental so going to try removing volume spacers which should do the trick. Love the GLX Transmission. Shifting is crisp and even better under load. Just takes a bit to get used to the controls.
review.name: Great frame,love the drivetrain

name: Switchblade Ride GX Transmission Mountain Bike

review.reviewBody: I bought this for all-day adventure runs where my 14L could hold all the stuff, but not hold it properly. This is a great pack for distributing weight evenly, providing quick access to snacks from the front pockets, and holding all kinds of stuff. I really love the pole pockets. My only complaint: it's big. I bought the Women's Small (I don't think an XS is available), and even fully loaded, I have to fully cinch it. It does bounce a bit when I run downhills, chaffing my sides. Unfortunately, the chest straps are stretchy, which adds to the problem of getting a tight fit. Other issues that may influence your decision: there isn't a place on the shoulder straps for an inReach or GPS device (most ultra running packs have a mesh pocket for that). And there aren't any small pockets to stuff things like your ID - it's just one big bucket in there. That doesn't bother me, but I know some of my friends struggled with organizing. Overall I like the pack - I just wish it came in a smaller size. For size reference, I'm 5'5", 32-D chest and longish torso.
review.name: Great vest - needs a smaller version

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this pack - bought it primarily for multipitch climbing. But it hasn’t quite held up to the job. After just a month of use (probably 10 days out) there are small tears developing in the bottom of the bag (on the durable ripstop fabric!). And the shoulder straps aren’t adjustable so it’s hard to crank it down tight, especially since it doesn’t have the waist belt. It carries well with a light load, but at max capacity I wish for more strap adjustability than it has. 

That said, it might be the right bag for your application! The stretch outside pocket is surprisingly durable, I love the running vest chest pockets, and you can get a lot in it (maybe too much in it). But it isn’t very durable.
review.name: Good in theory but not durable

name: Distance 22L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket. I took it on a spring snowboard trip and it worked great. The pit zips really helped as the day warmed up. The mapped insulation also works well.
review.name: Quality jacket

review.reviewBody: Used for the first time yesterday in a downpour of wet snow and a little rain, dry as a bone at the end of the day.  Great features to store your ski pass and everyday carry items (phone, keys, wallet).
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Warm, great fit and durable jacket. Love the fit and very comfortable
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: The jacket fits great and is very warm and waterproof
review.name: New favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: Great Jacket. Great ventilation. Kept me dry and warm in Tahoe blizzard. Only buy Goretex! Its the best! Don’t accept anything else!
review.name: Jacket is the bomb!

review.reviewBody:
I just got this jacket, but by first impressions of use... WOW! This thing is exactly what I wanted. I have a shell for warmer days but had to bundle too many layers to stay warm on those cold days. I run very hot while skiing, I get to the bottom and need to strip or open all my layers to not overheat. This jacket gives you breathability while carrying the insulation that keeps you warm on the chair up. 

Literally the only thing that could be improved is the size of the armpit ventilation. Like I mentioned above I run hot so I would have enjoyed more airflow when I open the vents. But that tiny detail is the only thing I can find at fault and it's more of a personal preference. Bravo Mountain Hardwear!
review.name: The Perfect Jacket

name: Cloud Bank GORE-TEX Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So this is my third pair of crush pants! They are the warmest lounge pants/joggers ever. And they are long enough for me (Im 5'10").
review.name: Love the Icebreaker Crush Pants!

review.reviewBody: I have an older version of Crush Joggers in size M that are too big. So I ordered the S in the Baja color. The crotch on these is so low that it looks absolutely ridiculous and feels annoying. I ended up keeping them but I have to fold the waistband down so they look and feel okay. I kind of wish I hand't kept them. It's not the same as an easy comfy pull-on jogger when you have to keep adjusting and folding the waistband. Please bring back the old fit!
review.name: Bring back the old Crush Joggers!

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of icebreaker joggers in 2021 that were amazing: lightweight, warm and really flattering fit. The big challenge with those pants was the fabric was subject to getting holes, which I had hoped was remedied by this new version. Perhaps that problem has been dealt with, but the fit here is just not flattering. Going back. Would happily try again if you bring back a "classic" fit from three years ago and durable fabric!
review.name: So sad - these do not fit like joggers bought in 2021

review.reviewBody: These were just what I've been looking for forever. And they fit perfectly, with one exception. The rise is sooo low. I am of short stature so am used to compromise, but I could hardly walk in these.
review.name: Why the lower rise?

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had a pair of these that was a couple years old and much loved. Decided to spring for a new one as I wear these so often. The new pair was a thicker and felt like higher quality wool. Some real improvements in an already great design. Better pockets and waistband. True to size.
review.name: even better than before

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have owned an original pair of the crush II pants and love them but this new version fit weird with the crotch too low for me. Returned them immediately.
review.name: Weird fit- low crotch

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. I bring them on expeditions for sleeping. Breathable, loose fitting, nice looking. Good for travel. just the pockets are so swallow a phone can't sit in them-deeper pocket please!
review.name: LOVE. Quality. One adjustment-pockets

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these pants but they fit so odd. The waist is too high and not as comfortable as the original Crush pants. The crotch area looks weird, frumpy, and the pants don't look as sleek and overall are just not comfortable compared to the original. The material is also not 100% wool, not as nice/quality of material as the previous version. I had to return even though I loved the purple color. I really hope the IB team rethinks this and goes back to the classic original design. I'm glad I stocked up on the previous version because this one is just not as good.
review.name: Previous Crush much better

review.reviewBody: Cannot attest to long term on this item, but at a month almost constant usage and washing- great durability. No pilling or holes or loose strings, seams look good. Flattering on my very wide, high waist figure. Not too see through! I just really wish they had more colors, especially earth or jewel tones. They rarely seem to have any colors that look good for an "autumn" person. Also I want to note that I also bought a W**lly competing pant and they had holes immediately. Sticking with the icebreaker.
review.name: Solid sweat pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are very comfortable but run on the short side.
review.name: Very comfortable

name: Merino Crush II Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice jacket, fits great.
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This girl's jacket has a beautiful boysenberry color, the material is warm, and the fit is mostly good. Because this is a ski jacket, NF has a standard snow gusset elastic piece that is meant to keep the snow from blowing upwards into the person when skiing. The elastic on this jacket is either too tight, or it's an indication that I'm too fat to fit it. If the gusset elastic wasn't there, this jacket would have fitted perfectly. I pondered on cutting it off to keep the jacket but decided against it. The gusset also caused a bump, where the fabric gathered on one hip only, not both. I think that's a sewing quality issue. Returned.
review.name: Good jacket overall but with a somewhat design issue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed a warm winter coat for my daughter and this met all my expectations. Plus the colors are beautiful.
review.name: I would purchase this product again

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Lightweight 5L Compression Sack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lightweight 5L Compression Sack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Lightweight 5L Compression Sack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using Granite Gear cordura compression sacks for many years but took a chance on the Sea To Summit compression sacks. To my surprise, they were not only equally rugged enough to meet the rigor of my motorcycle travel, they were also lighter and more water resistant. Quality product for sure!
review.name: Tough Enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When I first bought it, I thought there was no way my massive sleeping bag could fit inside. I was wrong. Stuffs perfectly in and fast, too. Feels durable and I’ve had no complaints so far. It also compresses down smaller than other similar sacks I’ve tried. 10/10!
review.name: Deceptively amazing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have several sizes of these and use them all. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great sack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it for a 10 deg hammock under quilt as mine only came with a stuff sack. Works well and is lightweight making it easier to keep things in my bag organized and where I want them in my bag. I've only used it 3 times so far but i don't see any issues of wear and tear for many years as i don't usually beat up a compression sack. I don't store my quilt in it when it's not being used, I just hang it on the hanger with the quilt.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This isn't my first Sea to Summit compression sack. They are durable and well-made and just don't seem to tear or fail. You can really pack a sleeping bag into it. And even though it's not water proof, it does seem to repel water.
review.name: Durable and really compresses

review.reviewBody: This compression bag was going to be for my hammock down under quilt but I was hoping this bag was going to be a little stronger but I'm very weary of the compression straps, it's going to fail me at the wrong time and at that time it's going to be called a fancy trash bag. I would do a return on it but a week out on that is not worth it.
review.name: My little bunny

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked wonders for compressing my clothes in my “personal item” carry on. Fit everything I really needed for a 6 day lake stay (granted it’s summer clothes and bathing suits which take up less space). Looking forward to using it this winter when doing some hut trips, too. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Helpful for “Personal Item” Compression

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect! It was exactly what I was looking for to get my 0* down quilt down to a packable size! Get's the job done and keeps the water out when inside my pack!
review.name: Perfect! It was exactly what

name: Lightweight 5L Compression Sack

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic - Women's
Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I overheat super easy and sleeping bags tend to make me pretty uncomfortable.  I bought a marmot bag years ago and it was my absolute favorite. Super lightweight and compact,  it keeps me warm but never overheated and there was never any issues with the zippers. I ended up loosing that bag and not buying a new one for a couple years. I finally decided to get a new bag and figured marmot would be the best place to look. It turns out not only did they still make the same bag it's not made out of more eco-friendly materials! I ordered the bag and got it very quickly in the mail and am very pleased with my purchase. I can't wait to be able to go out with my own sleeping bag again!
review.name: Exactly what I wanted

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody:
At this point I have only used the sleeping bag for 2 nights in Central Florida. The first night the low temp was 42 degrees F. I was plenty warm even had to unzip the sleeping bag at times. I look forward to using the sleeping bag on my trip to Torres Del Paine in December this year. 

Keep in mind that this bag comes in either a left or right zip. Some websites only carry one zipper configuration. My first bag was a right zip bag. As a right handed person, this was awkward for me.
review.name: Marmot Trestles Elite Eco 30

name: Trestles Elite Eco 30 Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic - Women's

review.reviewBody: I live in Phoenix, AZ and hike every morning with my dog.  The trails are rocky and hard on shoes - these are up for anything.  Great shoes, tread wears well for the abuse I put them through.  They run small so I had to send back for larger size
review.name: They rock

review.reviewBody: My 4th pair of these hiking and backpacking sneakers. Comfortable and last well.
review.name: Comfy out of the box!

review.reviewBody: I have probably posted a glowing review some years ago on these shoes. These are the only athletic-type shoes that have touched my feet in the last 20 years or so. Thank goodness they still make them. They are kinda difficult to get on (as several reviews have noted) as they have a deep heel cup. I use a long shoe horn and that works very well, so getting them on is no big deal. I do not run trails, but I do walk a lot for exercise and these shoes are great as casual shoes, for the gym, walking in the park, and so on. I have difficult -to-fit feet and need a wide toe-box but also can't have the lace holes too far down toward my big toes as they (my big toes) have big spurs on them. And that ability of these shoes to not antagonize my spurs is worth its weight in gold. I still highly recommend these for a variety of venues.
review.name: Still the one

review.reviewBody: The shoes are comfortable but are very difficult to get on - I use a shoe horn which has helped tremendously.  I also ordered one size up which I think fits better.
review.name: Helpful Hint

review.reviewBody: I love everything about these shoes, they fit great and are so comfortable... but getting them on is terrible. They don't have the pull tab at the heal (that so many other shoes have) to help, so you have to jab your thumbs in help get them on your feet. Even with that, it isn't fun. In the winter, getting these shoes on is at the TOP of my list of most dreaded chores (not to be dramatic), but cold fingers + having to work this hard to get them hard is terrible. If it wasn't for this, I'd give 5 stars for sure.
review.name: Incredible ONCE you get them on

review.reviewBody:
I have a heck of a time finding shoes that are comfortable, durable and that just fit well... I've gone through most of the popular brands a couple of times now and figured I'd give the wildcats one more shot. My problem with them the first time I tried them was that I should have gone up a full half size instead of the weird 1/4 size... So I normally wear a 10.5 and bumped up to an 11 (44.5) and they fit fantastic. 
Roomy toe area, SOLID heel lock and excellent cushioning. They give my feet some room to swell and are still comfy... Do I wish they were a little lower drop? Yep, but that has bothered me less than I thought it would... My knees and lower back actually feel really good after wearing these! 
So give them a shot and don't be scared to order at least a 1/2 size up, maybe a full size...
review.name: A real game changer for me

review.reviewBody:
Solid, confident footing. Cushioned from stones and such. only have 5 miles of trail running in them, but right out of the box, no problems.
Definitely agree with ordering a full size up. I normally target 9 EEE, 9,5 W.
I ordered a 43 which is a 10 in US and got lucky. Snug in heel and mid with room in the toe box. Took UPS 6 days to deliver, sat 3.5 days 40 miles away after upgrading to second day.
Excellent shoe.
review.name: As Described !

review.reviewBody: A good shoe for hiking and light trail running. Not the most cushioned shoe however. Tread pattern has good grip, and I have had no durability issues with the upper or the sole. I also wear La Sportiva mountaineering boots and climbing shoes, and they have fit true to size compared to what I wear in Nepal Cube GTX's and Solution's.
review.name: Sturdy

review.reviewBody: Wore these on a 31 mile AT section hike this weekend after two 10 mile break-in walks.  I was concerned around comments about these shoes slipping on wet surfaces.  I hiked a day and a half in the rain over rocks, mud, water, grass and logs without a single slip!  Either Sportiva made some modifications or the other reviewers experienced different conditions.  I turned in my 500 mile Vasquez?s for these and was pleased with the LaSportivas!  Highly reccomend.
review.name: Approved!

review.reviewBody:
I haven't done any super long hikes in these yet, but so far they feel great! Wish I had just a tiny bit more room in the toe box, but they feel fine. I will say they run small, I ended up having to get 11.5 and I don't wear that size in any other shoe, so keep that in mind. 

(edit)

After walking around the neighborhood in these a bit, I did a 35 mile trip through snow (UGH) and these felt great! No break-in period really, felt comfortable instantly. They did feel a bit too cushion-y at first, but I've gotten used to that. They are SO grippy! So grippy that they feel almost sticky when I'm wearing them, which is awesome. 

(edit again)

The only thing I HATE about these shoes is they don't have the pull tab thing on the back of the heel. Putting these on dry is fine, but when you have to put them on wet with wet socks (frequently since it rains here a lot), it's a PAIN.
review.name: Feel great, but run small

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Phantom 15 Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've owned and used many many sleeping bags. I still own many bags, probably too many. Some are super light and compressible, some are super warm and protective in the gnarliest conditions. After using this bag on a couple of trips, I can already see that it may soon become the only bag I need, and may ever need. It hits such a sweet spot in so many ways. It’s amazingly light and compressible for how warm it is. The 15F temp rating seems too low. I feel like it’s warmer than other 15F bags I’ve used in the past [including an older phantom 15]. and impressively, the fit also seems roomier than other bags i’ve used in this temp/weight class. The lining fabric is super buttery soft and the black color not only feels warmer [i assume because it absorbs more heat? maybe this is just perception], but it also seems to dry out much quicker when flipped inside out in the morning. I’m not sure what i’ll do with my other sleeping bags, but at this point the only bag I need [and want] to be using is this one.
review.name: the only bag needed

name: Phantom 15 Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

review.name: Very nice bag

review.reviewBody: Bought this and already used successfully and happy with purchase.
review.name: Great overall luggage.

review.reviewBody:
I love the design and layout of this bag. I also have the 100 L version. However, after one trip, there is a giant tear along some of the stitching. Backcountry is out of stock, so I can't exchange it. Steep and Cheap has the same one in the same color. However, I have to return this item. In the meantime, I purchased the same item from Steep and Cheap AND paid for shipping, making the exchange more expensive than the original item because I bought the original item at the Backcountry Retail store and didn't have to pay shipping. 

Not the greatest service, especially considering Steep and Cheap and Backcountry are the same company, even though they don't like to advertise this information.

I'm disappointed in Dakine's quality control and the Backcountry's customer service.  

Backcountry's retail store model isn't helping the situation. Anyone who has been there knows what a pain it is to shop and then have to deal with this for an exchange, which makes the experience that much more frustrating. I'm getting tired of dealing with Backcountry, as this is becoming a common issue. 

Backcountry's model is more concerned with their own efficiency than customer service. They don't appear to care about the customer's valuable time. 

I'll consider shopping elsewhere from now on, especially since returns are difficult and common with Backcountry.
review.name: Great Design, Poor Quality

name: 365 Roller 120L Gear Bag

review.name: Love These Shoes

review.reviewBody: I've purchased 1 or 2 pair of flips for several years now...love the color selection
review.name: I live in these!

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of hoka products, I purchased many items from it , I was always very very satisfied but this time I am very very disappointed, those sandals feel very cheap, the color is not white but ugly color that I didn't like at all, they are not comfortable.
review.name: Bad product

review.reviewBody: Not as "plush" as I would like. Matter of fact, there is little to none starting mid-foot and especially at the toes, its very very thin. Overpriced for what Hoka promises.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I've worn fitflops, oofos, and hoka has best support. Just wish they were cuter to wear with cute summer outfits ‍♀️
review.name: So very comfortable with great support.

review.reviewBody: Have had planters fasciitis and a torn Achilles tendon on left foot. The Ora Recovery Flips are great. I keep 2pair at all times. Only shoe I wear inside and almost always outdoors. I wear them for the comfort and everyday wear.
review.name: I will buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: I love HOKA but these flip flops run narrow at the straps and are so tight on my feet that it literally caused pain so I went back to wearing my old ones.
review.name: Flip flops

review.reviewBody: I have now had 2 pairs of Hoka recovery sandals. They have been my favorite! Comfortable and even work well for a long dog walk. I'm sad however as now without thinking both have been left on the deck and as the hot afternoon sun comes around they have shrunk. It doesn't take long and they are too small to wear. Sigh. My recommendation is with a caveat.
review.name: Unfortunately

review.reviewBody: After having 4 surgeries on one foot in 2 years being in a boot has really made it to where I can't wear shoes anymore. I originally hate wearing shoes to begin with. But these flip flops are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn! My foot don't give me issues as long as I have them on. They are very comfortable and very supportive.
review.name: Comfort!

review.reviewBody:
I really like the jacket. It’s comfortable and fits well. It’s a perfect extra layer for mid season or summer days in the mountains around sunset. My only complaint is the one pocket. With the center zipper, I don’t know why they didn’t add a pocket on each side at least. Especially with the lack of longer sleeves with thumb-holes, it would be nice to be able to put your hands in pockets or at least more than a phone. Otherwise, the fit is flattering and the waffle material is nice. However, it seems to be designed for fashion and not as much function which is a disappointing turn in many outdoor clothing items these days. 

Regarding size, I initially tried a small, but the sleeves were very short.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Incredibly warm and gortex outter helps keep in the heat. I’m using it to stay warm during low intensity activities like walking, but would be useful for hiking etc as well
review.name: Incredibly warm

review.reviewBody: Perfect length, beautiful colour, lots of pockets and extremely warm!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this in black for an extended trip to Greenland. For sizing reference I purchased an XL to accommodate 44in hips but fit a L everywhere else (with sweater underneath). It did well in the winter and I appreciated that it wasn’t bulky like most parkas. There are plenty of lined pockets which was convenient. The lined hood felt restricting when it wasn’t in use but I appreciated its close fitting structure once I used it. I had a liner jacket ready, thinking it might be necessary but nope! This parka does it all and stay dry and warm no matter the activity. Mine was used primarily in snow while hiking/walking and extended time outdoors in rough arctic winters. No better test than that! If fashion matters to you, it was as streamlined as an arctic parka can get. There is a toggle to make the waist cinch if that’s your thing. All in all a great parka I’d highly recommend.
review.name: Survived Greenland Winter

review.reviewBody: Don't be fooled by the number of 700+ fill power this jacket has way less insulation than you think. Not sure how some people in their reviews called it bulky. I love every details of this jacket honestly - GoreTex canvas shell, polar fleece lined hood and pockets, lots of pockets etc... But I am sorry this jacket just isn't warm enough for you to go anywhere below -15. It's thin and not as puff as you think a 700+ down jacket should be. Very disappointed!
review.name: Too thin and not enough insulation

review.reviewBody: I've been hunting for a winter coat for months. This coat has finally hit all my criteria! Lots of pockets, a tough and sturdy shell, roomy enough to wear with a sweater, cuffs, and a lovely turtle-green color. This coat is perfect for me. I'm in a rainy Northeast town and this coat is both warm and waterproof.
review.name: THE DREAM COAT for rainy Northeast

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket specifically for walking the Oregon coast in wet weather. It is precisely what I needed. As I get colder than most, I have to add an additional down sweater layer inside, for which this jacket is designed, but otherwise it's perfect. I walked the wet redwoods, and on many beaches, and it did exactly the job I wanted. It can be bulky for some; I would not take this on adventure travel as it's way too big and bulky. But for local use with the rain and wind, terrific. Plan for it to be roomy for layers. Love the many pockets.
review.name: Just what I wanted but for one detail

review.reviewBody: I used this parka when traveling to northern Norway in January. Average temps were around 20F/-6C but lots of wind in some locations. I generally run cold so I wanted to make sure I had something warm and versatile enough for the various tours and time I would spend outside. This parka nailed everything I was looking for! Amazing windproof tech. Plenty of pockets and large enough to fit what I needed (no need for a purse as I was roaming around town). Large inside pockets for my mittens or gloves. Love the inside breast pocket for my phone, I realized keeping my phone there was perfect so it would stay warm with my body heat. This parka seriously made my trip so much more enjoyable knowing I was warm enough for anything thrown at me. Paired with OR merino wool base layers was a huge plus.
review.name: Arctic Adventures Approved

review.reviewBody: Bought this for the fridge Alaskan winter. Meets all expectations and then some!
review.name: Warm, waterproof, windproof

review.reviewBody: This coat is warm enough for most days in Northwestern Ontario, but since I sized up, I could fit a lot of layers under it to be comfy in any temperature. Good against wet snow. The only thing I wish was different was the hood is quite large and there's no drawstring, so you can't see much when it's up and I don't think it would handle a strong wind well (but in that case a hat would do the trick)
review.name: Warm and waterproof

review.reviewBody: I used all winter, and it's great overall. Really high quality and definitely rain and wind proof. My only complaint is that below -20, I needed more insulation to stay warm. The good news is that the coat is big enough that you can fit lots of layers underneath!
review.name: Would recommend.

review.reviewBody: This bag is durable, fashionable and has a lot of useful space. I love it
review.name: Love it.

review.reviewBody: I LOVE THIS BAG. I use it every day as my work bag because it has a laptop sleeve and is lightweight. It can fit my stanley cup (with handle) in the adjustable side pockets. I also use it as my carry-on for flights because it has a luggage sleeve and it fits on my rollerbag. The brown color is perfect. 10/10 - would buy again!
review.name: Favorite bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace a work-issued laptop backpack that was poorly designed and a huge pain to use. This bag blew my expectation out of the water. Roomy but somehow still compact and comfortable to carry. The laptop sleeve fits both my 13 inch work laptop and portable second screen, and I can fit all my cords, mouse, and headphones in one exterior pocket. I can fit an extra layer, notebooks, and even office flats in the main compartment and I love that this has a suitcase handle sleeve on the exterior for travel. On top of that, it us durable and comfortable to carry. I love this bag and will use it for a long time.
review.name: A very good investment

review.reviewBody: I love this tote so much, I bought one for my sister and I will probably buy one for every new mom I know. It is seriously the best bag. I use it for work on the weekdays, I walk to work and it is really light and easy to carry, and then on the weekends I turn it into our diaper bag no problem at all. I even wear it while I am using a baby carrier. I have used it for traveling twice with two little kids and it is absolutely perfect because you can see everything and it all stays organized. Love the double water bottle pockets and the outer zip pockets. And even when it is stuffed full, it is really comfortable to carry. Can't say enough good things about this bag.
review.name: The perfect mom tote!

review.reviewBody: This bag is perfect for traveling! I used it for my personal bag item on my flights and it fits good under the airplane seat and it also fits securely on my luggage. Love it!
review.name: Definitely a must!!

review.reviewBody: This bag is amazing. I can fit my iPad Pro and my MacBook Pro 16 inches in my wallet and some diapers and wipes. This is my favorite bag.
review.name: I most definitely would buy this bag again

review.reviewBody: Using the tote for my college books and iPad. Easy to carry, nice shoulder strap. Very well made and was highly recommended by other students. I live in Alaska and I only buy North Face coats, clothing and accessories. I'm loving this tote!
review.name: Yes, I love North Face, excellent brand.

review.reviewBody: Good bag with just the right amount of space for a short trip. The laptop space adds a nice barrier inside the bag. It got the job done.
review.name: Might buy one more

review.reviewBody: I used this bag as my gym/change of clothing bag. But I have a few Pros and Cons: Pros: - Decent in terms of space provided - Water bottle holders on both sides - Two quick-access medium-size pockets in the back; One large pocket in bag - Hooks sewn-in inserts along the upper rim of the bag Cons: - Space is not big enough to just hold all your clothes if you just throw your stuff in, so must fold your clothes before placing in bag. - The shoulder strap attachment is REALLY bad and sometimes can just pop-off. I get the design North Face tried to implement but it feels cheaply made and constantly unravels
review.name: Small-to-Medium Gym Bag

review.reviewBody: I didn't know the back pocket didn't have a bottom. So all my stuff fell out. What's the point of it? Other than that I like it a lot.
review.name: Would buy another in another color

name: Base Camp Voyager Tote

The CS is slightly more narrow than my other Drone LVs which fits my foot even better. I love how easy it is to edge in these shoes!
review.name: I sent my project in these!

review.itemreviewed: Standard Mid Chelsea Snow Mte Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my go to boot for going to the ski hill. They are super easy to slip on after a long day in the ski boots and keep my feet nice and toasty and they are waterproof enough to get through those sloppy spring time parking lots. #BackcountryGeraheads

review.itemreviewed: Standard Mid Chelsea Snow Mte Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got a pair when I saw them on sale. I put them on and quickly realized the sawing seam of the left shoe between the rubber and the soft part just above my heel was not sawed smoothly. I took them off and touched the area with my fingers.  You would feel and tell right away that It is clearly sawed/assembled wrong.  The right side is nice and smooth but the left side has a significant bump which rubs my heal so badly. To my disappointment, I have to return these. My size is gone and no longer available either. :(
review.name: Defected (Left side, rough sawing seam)

review.itemreviewed: Standard Mid Chelsea Snow Mte Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: these are not waterproof at all, they leak from the soles and leave you with wet feet. Burr.
review.name: Run small NOT WATERPROOF

review.reviewBody: I wear a MD size motocross helmet and this one in MD/L fit perfect. They include extra pads with various thickness to customize to your own comfort. Very light and breathable, also can wear sunglasses or goggles just fine.
review.name: Good fit and quality

review.reviewBody: I?ve been riding with this helmet for about a year now. Super-light, comfortable, and cool. Only marginally warmer than my half shell. Use it for chairlift serviced downhill and gnarlier downhill terrain that i need to climb for. It is cool enough that you can climb with it on. Also a great trail helmet for cooler temps. Has held up well to a year of use with zero issues. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody:
Yet another quality helmet. Extra paddings came with the box. If your head circumference is right at borderline, I suggest you go one size bigger. Ventilation is perfect.

One thing I have noticed in both my Stage and A1 purchases is that the color on the photo does not always match that on the actual products. E.g. I bought the green camo, when it is actually blue-ish (see attached). I like better the actual color on Stage, but had to return A1 for the color reason. TLD needs to fix their photos.
review.name: Excellent Vent; Light; Mysterious Color

review.reviewBody:
Yet another quality helmet. Extra padding’s came with the box. If your heard circumference is right at border line I suggest you go one size bigger. Ventilation is perfect.

A few things were wrong about this glove.
1. Ebony wasn't really it. It's not black, which I thought it was, but this was more like dark blue.
2. A pointer finger on the left hand was sewed on wrong. The seam on the tip sit right on my nail and it looks twisted. No matter how many times I tried to fix, it does not sit straight. Uncomfortable.

I was disappointed, but it's warm and light to wear, though.

review.reviewBody:
Love this jersey.  It’s lightweight and looks great. Unfortunately it runs small. Normally I wear a size small and size up for aero fit. I purchased a medium.  The medium is ver small and sadly I am returning. 
For reference I am 5’7”, 135 lbs.
review.name: Colorful But Runs Small

review.reviewBody: I ordered both styles in small.  My typical size is S and my measurements fall within the Giro size S range.  I like my road jerseys trim fitting, but these were like children's clothes!    I am reordering in sizes M and L, but may have to try XL!   I am 5'6", 125 lb., typical cyclist build (more weight in my lower body).  For reference, I took measurements of the garment as it was lying flat.  At the widest part of the shoulder (tip to tip) = 15.5', the narrowest part of the waist = 11", and the bottom band at the widest = 14".  You can double these if you want circumference.  Tiny, right?!  As far as the fabric and quality, all seems well.  I'll report back.
review.name: Fits VERY small

name: Chrono Elite Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Poor sewing. Belt loop unstitched after one washing

comment: Thank you for bringing this to our attention.  Please know that we are committed to improvement and If you'd like to discuss your concerns further, please reach out to us directly.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have bought three pairs of these in the past year or year and a half. All of them have torn in the same place, near the zipper whenever I go to sit down. Really disappointed in the quality of them especially since I don’t wear them often. Just bummed in how poorly these have held up.
review.name: Torn in the same place in three pairs
comment: We are sorry to hear about the issue you outlined for the Men's Washed Out™ Shorts. This is not the experience we strive to create for our customers.  Please check out our warranty information by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking warranty.

review.reviewBody: Except for one GIANT problem, these shorts seem great (but aren’t because of the GIANT problem!). Once you wash them once, even if you don’t put them in the dryer (which it says you can do), they WRINKLE WRINKLE AND fabric DISTORT LIKE CRAZY. They are advertised as “ effortless style” — except for the fact that you have to IRON them every time you wash them. Ironing shorts? Sorry, that does not fall into the category of “effortless.” Sorry Columbia, your CEO should have to wear these shorts and iron them everytime. Until he quits wearing them. Did anyone even product test these?
review.name: Except for one GIANT problem
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. We appreciate you as a Columbia customer and your feedback is what helps us improve. Please reach out if you need further assistance.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice fit, good quality best of all they keep cool in the hot weather.
review.name: Columbia shorts the Best!!

review.reviewBody: They are true to size 8=8 so if you are 8 1/4 go up inside to 8 1/2. So warm, game changer. I just moved to where it is a lot colder and wet, I need this and they fit the bill perfectly. Warm, water proof (snow proof) and they look good!

review.reviewBody: Be advised the profile of the base for mounting cleats into is too low making it a real challenge to attach them.  See photo.  Bracket on left is my old one; bracket on right came with the shoes.  A 2-min job took 40 mins and required removing a bracket from an old pair of shoes.  Just another example of the cheap construction.
review.name: Cheap but seems adequate for indoor

description: Buy the Icebreaker Merino Flexi Chute Neck Gaiter online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Merino Flexi Chute Neck Gaiter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Merino Flexi Chute Neck Gaiter online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used as a facemask, including while running. Seems better to inhale wool than plastic like other gaiters I've seen. Comfy and effective. Does pill and get holes over time, but would by again and again
review.name: Second purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect laying piece for my cold morning runs. Surprisingly adjustable. Not itchy. Fast shipping. Natural fibers are the way to go. Take proper care of these items and they will last a really long time.
review.name: Perfect for chilly workouts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Use this multiple ways...neck warmer, hair band, face cover in cold. I have these in several colors.. pink, lazurite blue, black. They pair nice with my long sleeves and granary tops when I need a little extra warmth... and make it so those shirts are like a turtleneck. They could stand to be a little looser.
review.name: Enjoy the neck warmers

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use the Merino 200 Flexi Chute for outdoor activities, especially hiking and camping. The merino wool is incredibly soft, breathable, and keeps me warm without overheating. What I love most is its versatility-I can use it as a neck gaiter, headband, or even a beanie. It's lightweight and packs down easily, making it the perfect companion for any trip. The only slight drawback is that it can stretch out a bit after heavy use, but it always bounces back after a wash. Overall, I highly recommend this product for anyone seeking functional, durable gear!
review.name: Must-Have Versatile Comfort for Any Adventure

review.reviewBody: Loved the colour. Good fit to keep out the chill when skiing. Kept my neck warm and cosy.
review.name: Love this neck warmer!

name: Merino Flexi Chute Neck Gaiter

review.reviewBody: Salewa took the most perfect shoe -- the Wildfire -- and ruined it!  I have worn Wildfires for YEARS.  They have amazing fit, function and durability.  For whatever reason Salewa felt the need to ruin a good thing.  They changed the last, the midsole, the lacing, the fit and called it... the Wildfire 2 (how original).  Search out the original Wildfires, but DON'T BUY THESE SHOES!
review.name: These shoes BLOW!

review.reviewBody: I used it first for Camino de Santiago. It keeps my head cool under the sun, and perfect under my altus poncho to keep the rain off my face and getting the rain drip inside my poncho. It also dries quickly. We got lots of compliments along the way. This has traveled with me many times back and forth between US and Europe. It would look so beat up every time I take it off my luggage  but I would just leave it outside and it would reshape back perfectly. No lines nor creases. I bought a second pair to put my travel/backpacking patches on it.
review.name: Perfect hat, rain or shine

review.reviewBody:
Have to say that Backcountry ships this hat correctly. Originially bought off another big online retailer (think rainforest) and they folded the hat, forever creasing the foam. Returned that one, and bought from Backcountry for less and packaged correctly (in a box). The generous sale price was also great to see.

Great hat btw.
review.name: Shipped Correctly

review.reviewBody: Love the design and shade that it provides, it is incredibly comfortable to wear. I also appreciate the adjustable chin straps :)
review.name: Awesome Hat!

review.reviewBody: I live in the PNW, so it's always a little drizzly in the fall/winter. This is hands down the coolest hat ever, and I love that there is enough room to sit on top of the head and not smush my curls down. The adjustable chin and head straps are great as well. I bought this for my partner, but I find myself stealing it all the time for myself ;)
review.name: Coolest hat EVER!

name: Chillba Hat

review.reviewBody: So soft I love these overalls- fit is perfect-I love how the clips grab the straps and make it harder to twist straps, and the clips are high quality. The style is perfect.
review.name: Perfect overalls got the dark brown

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Carve's size finder suggested a size 2. I ordered both the 2 and the 4 and ended up keeping the 4. The 2 would not have left much room to wear more than a t-shirt underneath so maybe runs a little small. 
The dark brown color is nice and will go with a lot. 
Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
5'6, 120 lbs, over 50 yo.
review.name: Happy with purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these- the fit is great, they are so soft and feel cozy, and light weight! Definitely a fall favorite
review.name: Love these- the fit is

review.reviewBody: Love the buttery soft fabric and easy to match colors
review.name: Summer into fall

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love them! Really comfy and didn’t stretch out like the Jean overalls that I also bought yet still love as well
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: Carve pants and overalls are just too short. Waists are tight and hips too big. Please come out with a longer pant.
review.name: Weird fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my first overalls in decades and they are so soft and comfy! I have a long torso and was worried they'd hit too short in the bib, and while the straps are almost all the way out, they don't look weird. Plus this cord material is super soft and I love the Hydro color. I got a size 4 which is my normal bottom size in Carve, and these are true to size.
review.name: Good even for a longer torso

review.reviewBody:
Comfortable and I even had someone peek at the label at dinner the other day (they thought the overalls were cute too I guess!) 

My only complaint is I wish the sides of the overalls came up a little higher, you have to be thoughtful on the length of the shirt you wear so people can't see into the overalls.
review.name: Comfortable and good looking!

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable, nice colour. Size 6 fit perfectly
review.name: Extremely comfortable, nice colour. Size

review.reviewBody: I have several size 6 Oahu cord shorts, and a size 4 Carson jeans. I ordered a size 6 in these overalls and they were snug. Exchanged for an 8, and it only seemed to give me more room in the chest area. I tend to like my overalls loose and baggy- these were not cut that way. I bummed because they are super cute, but they just didn’t work.
review.name: Jason Cord Overalls

name: Jason Cord Overall - Women's

review.reviewBody: Wanted something of equal quality as my PI Attack shorts, but for a lower price. These are perfect. I think I like these LG's better, to be honest. Fit great. review.reviewBody: Fit great, feel comfortable. Love the drawstring waist. Thick padding allows me to ride for hours in them. I have some older Garneau shorts and tights that are still going strong and I will definitely be back for more.

review.reviewBody: I?ve had tons of shorts. I really thought I?d like these. The main crotch seem placement is BAD. I got rubbed raw on both sides under 40 miles. I will return them if possible. Worst shorts I?ve owned. And I don?t ever leave bad reviews.
review.name: Terrible design

review.reviewBody:
As others have mentioned, the stitching that holds the chamois pad in place is poor quality. Mine failed on two pairs or shorts after a handful of rides.

Caution: If you notice a stray thread, don't ignore it as I did. I put the bibs away for the season, then began riding next season only to realize the entire seam was slowly unravelling. Upon contacting Backcountry I was informed my purchase was no longer eligible for Castelli warranty claims due to a 2 year max on claims.
review.name: Poor quality stitching

review.reviewBody: Have had Castelli shorts before and loved them and they fit well. These are listed as men's size XL they might as well be boys medium.
review.name: Too Small

review.reviewBody: I'll keep the review short: upsize.  I ordered XXL and it was even tight.
review.name: Well constructed

review.reviewBody:
Yes, these fit snugly, because they are supposed to!  If you are looking for lycra shorts that Taylor Swift wears, these are not for you.
I have never owned a pair of "Pro-Level" bike shorts but I think these come pretty close for a medium level price.  The padding is enough and stays in place.  Everything I want out of a pair of bike shorts.  I will order again.
review.name: My fourth pair.  Love 'em

review.reviewBody: I bought three pairs of these shorts last year and after about 5-6 months of use the stitching on the inside pad detached on all three pairs and the gel pads slide out.  The material and all else is incredibly comfortable and durable but the stitching is a major problem.  You may only get a few months of use before this happens so at $140/pair you may consider trying something else.
review.name: Stitching on the Pad is a major problem

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my husband and he is always a size large. These did NOT fit. I had to re-order an extra large but worth it for the quality and fit.
review.name: Great short, great quality - runs small!

review.reviewBody: Purchased a large which should’ve been fine too small sent back for an extra large not much difference between the two sizes too small I don’t know if I will waste my time and do a xxl
review.name: Sizing chart is a disaster

review.reviewBody: Because previous reviews indicated that these shorts run small, I got Large rather than my usual Medium. The waist is too tight and the bottom of the shorts are loose on my legs. I am 5'8" and weigh 159lbs. The chamois isn't that great either. I would definitely not recommend these shorts.
review.name: A Big Disappointment

review.reviewBody:
I'd say these fit true to size, but that assumes you are used to Castelli.  I've had a pair of the Endurance 2 for a while and they've been great so I got a pair of these.  The fit is similar, they feel a little tighter, but I'm guessing that my old ones are stretched.  The waistband is the only noticeable difference, it's wider and flatter than the 2.  Like the last version, they run small, but don't fit as tightly as the race cut like the Competizione (which don't fit me).  I'm a short stocky guy (I wear small shorts but medium jerseys for my chest and shoulders), but they work for me.  
As far as fit: they are tight, they're compression shorts, and you are NOT going to simply step into them and pull them up.  I honestly have to put them on in stages and get the cuffs set around my thighs before I get them all the way on.  And you'll have to "position" pretty deliberately.  Once on, I find them very comfortable although the chamois sometimes takes a few minutes of riding to settle in since it can move a little in its 'pouch'.
So I definitely recommend them, just understand what you are getting.
review.name: Good successor to the Endurance 2

review.reviewBody:
I ordered XL which is my BIB sizing with most renowned brands to find out that the Short waist barely fits a thigh ! .... really small, I am a mortal like most amateur cyclist and don't have the Tour de France GC climbers waist ! XL should be mortals XL, I am not even sure is a XXXL (biggest size available) fits me, although my Pant/Jeans Waist is only 34".

Whilst the sizing / reviews mention that it fits small, the sizing info states that an XL is a 34" waist, so it's beyond wrong and misleading ... very disappointing.

Short quality is great which is expected from Castelli, sizing on the site is a disaster.

very unhappy and I cannot return it as i am not in US for now.
review.name: Way tooooo small fit

name: Endurance 3 Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a very well made and comfortable saddle. I purchased one for my first bike and I loved it. I purchased this one for my 2nd bike. The key to the Selle SMP saddles is to run it with a -1 to -3 degree nose down. Holds you in the pocket but you can still slide up to the nose when you need that power. I’d purchase again. Highly recommend. Find the one that fits your sit bones and enjoy the ride.
review.name: Lite 209

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few weeks ago and glad i did.  Very comfortable. No numbness in the nether regions as a guy.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I been using this model for the last 8 years, rode more the 10,000 miles. This years I tried others models, from SMP and selleITALIA. This is my third one, for me this is the one. Usually I ride 70 miles a week.
review.name: Really good saddle
