review.reviewBody: Tried on and fit was uncomfortable.   I was really wanting to like these shoes, unfortunately they have an weird feel and fit.
review.name: Uncomfortable fit

review.reviewBody: These were an upgrade from my pearl izumi flats, which were too skinny and getting beat up from use. Love 'em. They're sticky and comfortable for pedaling - I never have to t hink about my feet which is a nice change. Plus they aren't an eyesore. No complaints.
review.name: Sticky and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy that I finnaly invested in some good flat shoes, I’ve been riding and racing for quite a while now and the skate vans were not cutting it anymore. The grip to the pedal is great and my feet are comfortable and I also feel like they are protected from getting hit and stuff which is very nice. Very good shoes for a very good price.
review.name: Good comfort, great grip to the pedal,

review.reviewBody: The shoe is very simple, the finish is not special.  It needed new inserts to be wearable and then after two rides it got put in the give away bag.
review.name: This is a bicycle riding shoe.

review.reviewBody:
Shoes show a lot of promise but my word are they uncomfortable. Whatever "body geometry" they did to the soles is very uncomfortable. Had to turn around and cut the ride short as I could not take it anymore. If they ditch whatever wierd in sole they use I would try again.

They do run very small so order a size up. Toe box was quite roomy for a wider foot I thought. The sole was the main problem.
review.name: No to body geometry. Love stiff sole.

review.reviewBody: Great fit and support. I use it on my bmx and mtb. I went up one size.
review.name: Specialized 2FO Roost Flat Pedal Shoe

review.reviewBody: These are nicely crafted shoes but I returned mine. When companies try put support or special characteristics in a shoe it just ends up making them worse. Just make the shoe completely neutral and let the buyer put his/her preferred insoles or support. Putting on this shoe was like having my left shoe on my right foot. Otherwise, good high quality shoe with a decent but not excessive volume. Props to specialized for making a stiff shoe, something others seem to not understand.
review.name: Ditch the body geometry

review.reviewBody: Most importantly to me, the pedal grip is about as good as five ten and so is the sole durability. They're stiffer than a freerider and a little more armored. Fairly hot in the heat, but super solid shoe otherwise.
review.name: Great 5-10 alternative

name: 2FO Roost Flat Pedal Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Yes, these trail runners are a bit stiff and heavy. I use them more for hiking. Also, the toe box area has changed from the last models. It seems not as roomy and the shoe a bit longer. 

I hate it when the style changes.
review.name: A bit stiff

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The shoes look great and sturdy, and the waterproof is fantastic, but the form design is painful and too pointy, so I had to return them.
review.name: great shoe but painful

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: After trying several notable brands, I finally found the perfect hiking shoe for me! The Wildcat delivers stability and grip and still feels so comfortable! I also use it for road running, which it handles very well. Not cheap, but based on the quality, I think it will hold up for some years.
review.name: Happy Feet!

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: My fave performance from a runner. Sticky, stable , hard-core. This is my second pair. First ones lasted forever. Well made, always dry. I buy a half size up with this style, runs smaller than MY LYCAN models. Kept the shape, shank in sole mKes it was to spring off rocks and wood. Great for street or running deep in woods.
review.name: Love this shoe 2nd pair!

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: It might be hiking runner  but walking long distances in this shoe whether in trail or road is the best.
review.name: All around comfort and stability

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have worn the Ultra Raptor GTX for years.  It has been discontinued and this was recommended as the replacement.  It is a nice shoe but nothing like the Ultra Raptor GTX which fit my foot perfectly.  This shoe is way too big in the toe box for a narrow foot.  I was looking for a shoe for daily, shorter but difficult hikes and ended up getting the Spire GTX.  The fit is much closer to the Ultra Raptor GTX.
review.name: Nice shoe but too roomy

review.itemreviewed: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Perfect balance between day hiker and sneaker. Super comfortable. Been a fan of this style for years
review.name: Best all around shoe

name: Wildcat 2.0 GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: Prodry Bib Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Prodry Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Prodry Bib Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Prodry Bib Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Dry all day! In the past, I would just wear my waders if I knew it was going to rain really hard all day when boat fishing and not getting in the water. These are a game changer that I have confidence that I will not be wet in an all day soaker and do not have to wear waders anymore.
review.name: Goto pant when it’s going to be a soaker

review.reviewBody: Returned due to poor fit. SIMMS needs to offer extra long sizes
review.name: Returned - no fit

review.reviewBody: Best pair of bibs I’ve ever owned, I keep a pair on each boat.
review.name: Best bibs period

review.reviewBody: The Pro Dry was put to the test here in the PNW this last weekend! Rain, rain and sideways rain. I was bone dry! The best I've ever owned!
review.name: Pro Dry......The best I've ever owned!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic quality and durability. As a fishing guide in one of the most brutal environments “Venice Louisiana” weather is always a questionable topic daily. I no longer worry if I’m going to get wet any longer with this set up!
review.name: Fishing guide tested

review.reviewBody: I like everything but the zipper, it’s like having to zip up a Jacket. But other than that they perform great! I’d definitely recommend these to anyone looking for high end Bib, love having 2 cargo pockets and 2 hand pockets.
review.name: Pro Dry Bibs definitely a plus in my outerwear arsenal!

review.reviewBody: I???m in these each and every day during the season. Living in WI and fishing across the border in MN often makes for cool mornings and evenings even in the summer months. I???ve also had these in the Gulf of Mexico, the Pacific and Atlantic and everywhere in between. Salt water, fresh water, it simply doesn???t matter. I couldn???t be more confident in these bibs than I am.They are the most crucial part of my kit for sure. Then, once you???re out in the elements and staying dry becomes the focus, that???s when the Pro Dry really shines. The only way you???re getting wet in this gear is if you fall in and become completely submerged! Best there is.
review.name: MUST HAVE

review.reviewBody: As far as a bass fishing application, these bibs are the the best. The Simms ProDry bibs are what the rest of the industry is attempting to achieve. Best material and superior assembly, make the ProDry bibs bone dry and durable for years of abuse. It could use a little more room in the mid area and chest for layering in cold weather.
review.name: Best bass fishing bibs made

review.reviewBody: A step backwards from its predecessor, no chest pocket and a cheaper strap system. A bit bulkier too.

The best there is! If you need to protect yourself from the elements, you can't get any better than these bibs. 
They are made for slender body types and could have more room for extra layers or chubby types. 
After years of hard use they will stay with you. 
The competition does come close.
review.name: Best bibs made - HANDS DOWN!

name: Prodry Bib Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Long story short, I installed and tested them last night with the OEM mounting hardware and one bottle dislodged on a flat, paved trail.
Luckily, it did not get under my wheels; however, I no longer trust this product and will stick to traditional bottle cages.
In the photos below, you can actually see that the culprit was the plastic magnetic portion that is wrapped around the bottle detached, not the lack of snap between the magnets themselves.
For the price tag, the quality of these components should last more than 1 ride on a smooth road (not mountain biking nor was it on gravel).
review.name: Great concept, not in execution.

name: Twist Water Bottle Set

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very good experience buying. Duffel is exactly what I wanted.
review.name: Very good experience buying. Duffel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I own the original Transporter Wheeled Duffel 40 and 90. They have been all around the states and the world and have worked so well that I got the new 60 as well. I like the new name tag window. I miss the QR buckles on the zipper flap for security and weather protection, and I miss the extra webbing handle on the bottom as an alternative to the often dirty plastic handle of the chassis.
review.name: I own the original Transporter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven’t used it yet but it seems sturdy and roomy! Perfect for a 12 day trip that requires mid size luggage!
review.name: Haven’t used it yet but

review.reviewBody: Having a wheeled 60-liter back makes travel so much easier!  The water-proof fabric on this back keeps contents dry at the busstop, on the tarmac, or wherever there might be a drip!  The size works well for me for a week-long trip or a trip involving heavy winter clothes or extra footwear!
review.name: Nice size for week-long adventures

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the transporter wheeled series. Worth having one of each size depending on length of trip. Like the material and ability to protect contents in rainy or wet weather. Great size for week long trips. Well built and rolls easily on a variety of terrain. Tackles any subway, sidewalk, train, etc.
review.name: Love the transporter wheeled series.

name: Transporter Wheeled 60L Duffel

review.reviewBody: These have been awesome to use on all of my bike rides. and I love the color way!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use these for spin class. The upper is flexible and breathable. I leave off the laces to better accommodate an inflexible big toe joint. The velcro strap holds them on just fine. They will be easy to rinse out and fast to dry when needed.
review.name: Very comfortable and good value

review.reviewBody: Didn’t wear these , not my size . These are women’s shoes.
review.name: I had to return these shoes they were not my size.

review.reviewBody: I never review but compelled this time. 40 yr Mtn biker. A cleat option creates too much slide on a platform pedal. No firm rubber insert as an option with purchase, if you switch between clipless and platform pedals. Also, shoelaces surprisingly low quality.
review.name: Comfortable but lacks full function

review.reviewBody: I have the original trail cross  hiking and mtbiking shoes in size 10.5, and they are great, but these are very narrow in size 11. That means that they are not comfortable for ride.
review.name: perfectbut to narrow in comparison to the original

review.reviewBody: Great fit! Lots of wiggle room for my toes. I've had problems with other bike shoes having a really shallow toe box. These shoes don't have that issue. The sole is stiff for good power transfer but they are still comfy to walk in. I like the combination of laces plus velcro. It's easy to get the perfect amount of stability and also easy to get the shoes off and on quickly. I ride mostly around the city with a lot of stops for shopping plus some longer rides on gravel or paved surface.  The sizing is true to American athletic shoe sizing. Great bike shoe overall. So glad I found them.
review.name: Finally, bike shoes I did not have to return

name: Trailcross Clip-In Cycling Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Yakoda Supply Guide Laces84in online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Guide Laces84in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Yakoda Supply Guide Laces84in online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in the only size available, which was 84". Being that it was the only size available, I underestimated what an 84" lace would actually look like on a boot. 84" IS A LOT OF LACE! I don't even know what kind of boot or shoe you would need an 84" lace for. Maybe these were meant for a corset? Maybe these double as paracord and aren't for your shoes at all. You're supposed to string up a tarp with these and cowboy camp. In a pinch you could use them as a leash and walk your dog, but be carful on trails that have leash length restrictions, these might be too long.
review.name: Obnoxious

name: Guide Laces84in

review.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous seatpost, and I really like the two-bolt fixing system. Unfortunately, when I hold it up to my current lesser quality seatpost (which has zero offset), I can see this seatpost isn't going to work. The saddle support rails go too far back, and I would run out of saddle rail if I were to install it. I have a Selle SMP saddle which needs to be placed 10-15mm more forward than other saddles, and I can see now it will only work with a zero setback post and probably not every one of those. Just something to keep in mind in case you run a Selle SMP saddle. Hopefully Ritchey makes a zero offset post that's as nice as this one.
review.name: Gorgeous seatpost...but too much setback

name: WCS Carbon Link Flexlogic Seatpost

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket as a gift for my husband. When it arrived in the mail, I was pleased at the quality and look of the jacket. However, when he tried it on, the sleeves were slightly too long and his "tummy" poked out of the bottom of the waist line. When I called Dickies to see if ordering a "long"-sized jacket would correct the problem, they told me the longer size would also make the sleeves longer. Sadly, I had to return the jacket for a refund. I would have gladly ordered the longer size if the sleeves weren't going to be an issue. I would only recommend this product to someone who doesn't have "tummy" issues, or someone with really long arms.
review.name: The waist is too short for a man with a "tummy"

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my husband, who's a mechanic. There was no option for tall in his size, but we both have had good experiences purchasing Dickies apparel and decided to take a chance. Turns out, it was too short. Which is unfortunate because the price was great, the jacket was well made, and it arrived in a timely manner. My only complaint, when it didn't fit I had to pay to have it sent back. That was a bit costly, and will factor in the next time we order online.
review.name: Not long enough

review.reviewBody: Excellent... more will be ordered. Can beat the products.
review.name: Eisenhower Jacket, insulated.

review.reviewBody: ...just be aware that this pant is Hybrid fabric construction( Windstopper only on front/ breathable Power Stretch fleece on back) , NOT Windstopper front aand back as one could first assume from description/photos. Fine for hight aerobic output on a cold day, but a bit cool if output is moderate and temps colder ( say -10c and colder...). Fit however is true to sizing recommendation/chart.

review.reviewBody: It’s really warm , waterproof and comfy, I’m using it in winter outdoors activities and won’t feel cold

review.reviewBody: It’s really warm and practical, I’m using it for cycling in winter
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: I've worn many running pants over a span of 12 years, and these are the best I've ever had. They are incredibly comfortable! I don't feel restricted by them when running in the cold, winter weather. Moreover, sweat doesn't accumulate inside. Although I usually wear a size medium, the large was a better fit for me. You can't go wrong with these winter running pants. I'm about to order my second pair now!
review.name: Incredibly comfortable

review.reviewBody: Had the item for several months. I use the softshell 2-3x a week. Very warm. Good for stretching. Good for biking.
review.name: Warm SOFTSHELL

review.reviewBody: lovely, fit not too tight as may look like, kept me very warm on overnight trips. looks sleak too
review.name: great pant for cooler weather

review.reviewBody:
I loved the pants and have used them extensively- great fit , feel and performance.
My only grievance is the very minimal pocket - so small that phone for example does not fit. The pocket has a nice zipper but even +1cm all around would help - as it is one can squeeze with some effort a small iPhone in - but it is really too tight. Otherwise a 5 star product for all those who are not bothered by this particular feature
review.name: Great pants - small pockets

review.reviewBody: Very functional training pant. This product can handle extreme conditions.
review.name: Excellent heavy weather training pant

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Salomon Cross warm softshell to replace a very old Louis Garneault soft tights that I used to use for running.   So far, I've used the Salomons for Cross Country skiing, hiking and walking on cold days with a base layer long underwear underneath.
What I like
+ The fit - not too tight, not too loose and loose in just the right places for X-country skiing
+ The side zips to allow the bottom to go over my X-country ski boots - (I can sometimes avoid gaters)
+ The material and warmth

To improve
-The mini side pocket is only useful for lip balm
review.name: I love everything about them

review.reviewBody: I've been using a side zip pant for cross country ski instruction and decided to try these pants. Needed a warm pant and not skin tight. This has been perfect. I wear a thin tight underneath and this has perfect combination in negative temps and windy conditions. Another plus for me is that they aren't pitch black (so common) but have a slight blue hue to them. XL is a great fit for 34-36 waist and 32-34 inseam
review.name: Looks and feels Great

name: Cross Warm Softshell Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and the quality is nice it just is a little tight on the shoulder areas for people who workout
review.name: Comfortable a little tight fitting

review.reviewBody: Such a cozy hoody, love the zipper pocket in the pouch, might have to get another color!
review.name: So cozy

review.reviewBody: I have’s worn it yet because have to fix a hood. It is a little large for me but it is individual… In general the thickest hoodie I have. Perfect in width and length. Definitely recommend it go people, who like cozy cloths.
review.name: Perfect winter hoodie

review.reviewBody: This is my second one. Love this thing. Somehow blocks out wind as well.
review.name: Most Comfy

review.reviewBody: Like all 686, tops I’ve owned… I wish it was a little bit longer. Other than that I can’t find another complaint even though I’m trying to. It’s really thick and warm. I’m 6’4” 155lbs and got a medium. Fits really good other than the length, which again…6’ 4” so… that’s pretty typical. The inside kangaroo pocket zipper pocket is cool. I’ve litterally lost things inside it because it’s so thick that I can’t feel it without actually opening zipper. Would definitely recommend if you live somewhere with actual winter. If you’re in like Florida… might be a little warm for “winter” there.
review.name: “That MF’er thick”

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits as expected, true to size…I don’t like really baggy clothes and this M fit me loose without looking sloppy. 5’8” 145
review.name: Great Keith Haring addition with functional warmth

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice hoodie, super comfy. I’m wearing it right now
review.name: Nice hoodie, super comfy. I’m

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Another 686 product with exceptional quality and a perfect fit and design as always. It’s incredibly warm and comfortable and the Grateful Dead collaboration just nails this a a great piece to layer with either on the slopes or on the town.
review.name: Perfect hoodie in every way.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Oh boy! This Hoodie is a layer of comfort! The quality is super soft terry cloth material but still has that gangster fit! No doubt will keep you warm in the winter. I feel like a teddy bear with all the attention and hugs I get.
review.name: Teddy the Gangster!

review.reviewBody: Could be thicker but overall great fit & incredibly comfortable

review.reviewBody: On the coldest Alaska ski day these are my go to mitts.  They kept my fingers toasty and warm all day.
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: Very warm and cozy.  It’s so easy to click into the ski poles. I just love this set up.
review.name: Never cold hands.

review.reviewBody: I am not sure if these are the mitts or the gloves. The gloves I ordered are slightly small in an 8 and way too big in a 9. The down mitts that I ordered are great, although my finger tips still get cold on days in the teens.
review.name: Mitts and gloves

review.reviewBody: Love my warm down mittens. The intergrated straps are handy but I prefer to use the strap that come with the pole for added support. I am still breaking hem in but so far I really like them.
review.name: Down mittens

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these gloves! This is the 2nd pair I bought because I wanted a back up pair. The finger holsters inside the mitt provide very decent dexterity and the down keeps my hands warm even in single digit temps. These are the first gloves that have kept my hand warm.  I have Leki trigger poles and appreciate the integration of the mitts but I use them with all my poles- not just those with triggers.
review.name: Best Mitts -full stop!

hasVariant.name: Trail Mix Mitten
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Trail Mix Mitten online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very nice weight. Fit is larger than I had hoped. Only has a touch screen pad on the thumbs.
review.name: Okay mitts

review.reviewBody: I love these mitts. Lightweight to pack for every day hike and the perfect winter running mitt. I've been trying all types of gloves and mitts for winter running and these are my favourite.
review.name: Versatile and lightweight. Awesome for winter running

review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace OR Backstop Sensor mitt (which is no longer made) and this seemed to be the closest alternative. These ones are grid fleece, probably the same (minimal) amount of warmth of the Backstop but very little if any wind resistance. These are highly breathable however. They are also grid fleece which gives them a texture and I've found that tree debris (pine needles, etc) are easily stuck to it.
review.name: OK not great

review.reviewBody: These mitts are great. I have been taking them on fishing trips here in the rainy PNW weather. Once my hands get cold, I take out these mitts which fold up and pack up like there is nothing in my bag. I can even fit these into my pocket without any issue. It can dry my hands and keep them warm. Then I ring them out and keep on fishing and rinse and repeat. They're great mitts for casual use as well.
review.name: Pack up and keep warm

review.reviewBody: Great quality! They keep my fingers a perfect temperature while jogging and hiking
review.name: Love these mitts

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a pair of mittens to use for high output winter activities, like ski touring, and these keep my hands just the right amount of warm. The leather strip on the palm adds durability for the friction from ski poles. If your hands get too cold in gloves but too hot in some mittens, try these!
review.name: Warm and breathable!

review.reviewBody: Have worn these hiking and hok skiing several times. Work well and hands don't sweat. Not sure how material will hold up in wetter conditions.
review.name: Great high intensity mitt

review.reviewBody: Love this texture - soft but doesn't get stuck in velcro items. Spacious enough in the hands to fit a liner glove/mitten underneath.
review.name: Love the texture

review.reviewBody: They're not super warm but if you do need added warmth you can throw a hand warmer in! Love the softness & feel of the fabric!
review.name: Great product-love the fabric and warmth!

review.reviewBody: Warm, lightweight. Perfect for cold runs. Keeps my hands warmer than gloves and I don't need the dexterity on a run.
review.name: Just what I needed.

name: Trail Mix Mitten

review.reviewBody: You don’t have to worry about launching a bottle with this and it is SUPER light! It is very easy to get your bottles in and out of this.  It is the perfect holder for experienced cyclists seeking marginal advantages.
review.name: Keeps bottles in place!

review.reviewBody: These are a great looking and light-weight cages. However, they are difficult to secure a bottle while riding. I had to look down every time I replaced the bottle in the cage versus what is typically an easy process. I have sent mine back to something more forgiving
review.name: Difficult to place bottle while riding

This is the perfect layering hoodie that provides a light fleece for warmth and softness, but with zero bulk involved. The length does not feel overly cropped and gives enough coverage to still feel cute but keep you warm!
review.name: The perfect hoodie - Great fit and material
